doc.title: Haier Smart Home (600690.SS)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/Midea Group 0300.HK 9 OP expansion on 11 sales growth in 2Q25 9 OP expansion on 11 sales growth in 2Q25Midea Group 0300._2025-08-31

passages.text: 9% OP expansion on 11% sales growth in 2Q25

Midea's OP grew 9% YoY in 2Q25, with 11% YoY sales growth in 2Q25. Its 15% YoY NP growth in 2Q25 was again helped by F/X gain (Rmb1.5bn in 2Q25 vs Rmb1.2bn in 1Q25). Mgt lifted its guidance for 2025E group sales growth to \(\sim 10\%\) YoY (from MSD-HSD previously) with "YoY expanded" NPM (vs. "YoY stable" NPM previously). It targets to expand sales by MSD- HSD p.a. in the next few years. It also declared an interim dividend of Rmb0.5/sh (vs nil in 1H24). Haier and Midea remain our Top Buys in the China Home Appliance sector.

2025E outlook — Per mgt, installation vol of its air- con in China grew 15%+ YoY in July and mgt expects the growth rate to remain at "double- digit" in 2025E. Its OEM orders began to recover in an accelerated pace in July- Aug. Mgt is confident of positive group sales growth in each of 3Q25E and 4Q25E. In the mid- term, mgt targets at 50/50 mix for its to- C/to- B biz, with possibly more spin- off of to- B biz in future (in addition to its announced spin- off of Annto Logistics). Together with 1H25 results, Midea announced it will promote its VP Mr. Wang Jianguo to Executive President.

Sales performance of home appliance 2C biz — Group sales expanded 11% YoY to Rmb124bn in 2Q25. Revenue from the home appliance (2C) biz grew 9% YoY to Rmb81.9bn in 2Q25, within which China sales grew 15%+ YoY and overseas sales rose LSD% in 2Q25 (after \(\sim 30\%\) sales growth in 1Q25 amid front- end loaded overseas demand). OBM sales contributed \(\sim 45\%\) of overseas sales and OPM of OEM biz is about 0.8ppt above that of OBM biz, per mgt. 2Q25 sales by category (per mgt): Air- con sales grew 10- 15% YoY (China: \(+ \sim 25\%\) YoY; overseas: \(+ \mathsf{LSD}\%\) YoY), washing machine & refrigerator sales grew \(\sim 10\%\) YoY (China: \(+ \mathsf{HSD}\) YoY; overseas: up \(10\% +\) YoY) and kitchen appliances & other appliances sales stayed flat YoY (in both China and overseas markets). 1H25 sales by geography (per mgt): Overseas sales grew 15%+ YoY in 1H25 (vs. \(\sim 30\%\) growth in 1Q25). Sales in North America grew double- digit YoY and accounted for 22.4% of its overseas sales ( \(\sim 1\) ppt lower YoY) in 1H25. Sales in South America grew double- digit YoY and contributed \(\sim 13\%\) of its overseas sales (also slightly lower YoY) in 1H25. Sales in Europe grew 25%+ YoY and accounted for 25%+ of its overseas- sales (more than 1ppt higher YoY) in 1H25. Sales in APAC regions grew 20%+ YoY and accounted for \(\sim 22\%\) of its overseas sales (+1ppt YoY) in 1H25. Sales in Middle East region declined YoY and accounted for \(\sim 10\%\) of its overseas sales ( \(\sim 1\) ppt lower YoY) in 1H25. Sales in Africa region grew 20%+ YoY and accounted for \(\mathsf{M}\mathsf{S}\mathsf{D}\%\) of its overseas sales (slightly higher YoY) in 1H25.

2Q25 sales performance of 2B biz — 2B biz sales grew 16.6% YoY to Rmb32.3bn in 2Q25 per mgt. Revenue from Intelligent Building Technology biz grew 25%+ YoY (China: up 20%+ YoY; overseas: up 35%+ YoY), Energy Solutions & Industrial Technology biz sales rose 15%+ YoY (China: up 10%+ YoY; overseas: up \(\sim 20\%\) YoY),
BuyPrice (29 Aug 25 16:10)HK$81.75Target priceHK$119.30Expected share price return45.9%Expected dividend yield4.4%Expected total return50.4%Market CapHK$53,186MUS$6,821M

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.
and Robotics & Automation sales rose HSD% YoY (China: up 25%+; overseas: up LSD YoY) in 2Q25.

**2Q25 margins** — GP margin declined 40bps YoY to 26.2% in 2Q25. Selling expenses-to-sales ratio fell 10bps YoY to 9.0%and admin expense-to-sales ratio stayed flat YoY in 2Q25. Group OP grew 9% YoY in 2Q25, with 20bps of OPM contractionYoY (to 10.1%). Below the EBIT line, the company incurred fair value losses of Rmb288m (mostly F/X derivatives) and FX gains of ~Rmb1.5bn in 2Q25. Excluding fair value and FX gains/losses, Midea's pro forma NP increased by 8% YoY in 2Q25, in our estimate.
Figure 1. Midea 2Q25 & 1H25 results details

Our target price for Midea of \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 119.3\) is based on 19x 25E get P/E, same as Haier's target PE, to reflect improved earnings visibility on China operation.

Key downside risks that could impede the shares from reaching our target price include: 1) slower- than- expected white goods growth; 2) price war among white goods players; 3) slower- than- expected overseas expansion; and 4) higher- than- expected increase in raw material costs.

Our target price for Haier Smart Home is \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 41.4\) , based on a 17x 25E target P/E, a \(15\%\) premium to its 5- year trading average, reflecting its white goods leadership position with solid top- line growth and expected continued margin expansion going forward amid improved visibility on its China operation.

Downside risks that could impede the shares from reaching our target price include: 1) Slower- than- expected white goods growth in China; 2) Intense price competition and price wars; 3) A macroeconomic slowdown, with rural consumption cooling off and further weakness in the property market; and 4) Higher- than- expected increases in raw- material costs. Any of these risk factors could cause the shares to deviate from our target price.

Our target price for Haier Smart Home is \(\mathsf{Rmb}37.70\) , based on a 17x 25E target P/E, a \(15\%\) premium to its 5- year trading average, reflecting its white goods leadership position with solid top- line growth and expected continued margin expansion going forward amid improved visibility on its China operation.

Downside risks that could impede the shares from reaching our target price include: 1) Slower- than- expected white goods growth in China; 2) Intense price competition and price wars; 3) A macroeconomic slowdown, with rural consumption cooling off and further weakness in the property market; and 4) Higher- than- expected increases in raw- material costs. Any of these risk factors could cause the shares to deviate from our target price.
Our target price for Midea of \(\mathsf{Rmb}108.5\) is based on 19x 25E target P/E, same as Haier's target PE, to reflect improved earnings visibility on China operation.

Key downside risks that could impede the shares from reaching our target price include: 1) slower- than- expected white goods growth; 2) price war among white goods players; 3) slower- than- expected overseas expansion; and 4) higher- than- expected increase in raw material costs.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "-" and "-" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in

reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
